lines.text: The trouble with being sick is you have to associate with doctors.
[first lines]
Ain't it pretty!
[shows staff the newspaper's front page mock-up with screamer headline "JONATHAN REYNOLDS DEAD"]
[examing old newspaper photographs of Jonathan Reynolds Sr]
Well, his inheritance tax ought to make the country even.
He was born too late. Two hundred years ago, he would have been a pirate - Captain Kidd, himself!
Look at that stomach. I saw him at a banquet once. He didn't order a steak - he ordered a cow!
[praying]
20 - that dirty Herald has been getting all the breaks
[phone rings]
Yeah? What do you mean he isn't dead yet? Frank, I gotta have some action!
[to his dying father]

Oh, say, the fishing in Mexico - there's nothing like it. It's not really fishing... it's kind of big game hunting. They have fish with teeth and horns - a throwback to the buffalo. You go out in a boat and the fish charge at you. You just got to catch 'em in self-defense. You and I and two machine guns are going down there next month.
[two tycoons leave Anne a paltry tip]
This must be a new five-dollar coin they're putting out... it looks like the same old dime to me.
[Doctor Harvey disposes of Jonathan Sr.'s forbidden cigar]
Hey, that's a two-dollar cigar!
Where'd you get it?
Don't look at me - I smoke a pipe.
[Jonny drags Anne off the train to pose as his fiancee again, leaving her friends open-mouthed]
Come on, I'll give you another fifty dollars!
Well, what do you know!
Don't worry, Jenny, it's platonic. He wants her for his father.
I was just telling you about the fellow I used to go with. Turns out he was fickle - he married his fiancee.
Oh, I think you have a nice room. It's... different.
Uh-huh. On a clear day you can see all the way across it.
Has Doctor Harvey hidden my cigars?
Yes, sir.
Have you hidden my cigars from Doctor Harvey?
Yes, sir.
Jonathan I have a very pleasant surprise for you!
How long will you be gone?
[Jonny tries to convince his father that Anne hates him]
What did she call me?
A pompous, self-indulgent, overbearing imitation of a dictator.
[Jonny angrily chases Anne around his living room]
Going around pinching people at your age.
When I get three seconds older, I'm going to start punching people.
[Jonny is still chasing Anne around his living room]
If you hear something snap, don't turn around - it'll be your neck.
[a waiter brings Jonathan Sr. an enormous, fruit-fillled cocktail]
What's that?
It's a Reynolds Special.
Oh, but you shouldn't be... what's in it?
Oh, oh, nothing but, ah, coconut milk and, ah, vegetable juices. Doctor Harvey orders it for me. It's horrible.
Then why do you drink it.
It reminds me of Doctor Harvey and make me hate him and when I hate him, I feel good.
[Jonny drags Anne off the train yet again]
Lady, the next time you ain't goin' no place, why don't you try a plane!
You told me you'd have that picture destroyed!
Destroyed? If I'd done that, they'd never have seen it.
They?
Those women... those bead-twirlers. They called before they left.
They're gone! I mean... they've gone?
Well, they saw the picture in the paper. They said they were taking the first train to Mexico City. I advised them to take a plane - *quicker*.
[last lines]
All right, I'm sorry I pinched you.
Honest?
Hm-hmm.
You'll never do it again?
Never.
Promise?
Hm-hmm.
[Jonny leans forward as if to kiss Anne]
JONNY!
He's gonna die for me, exclusive!
I have a very pleasant surprise for you.
Oh yes? How long will you be gone?
